page.title: 08Farming, the worker.
page.content: The day started off at 7.00am when it was time to get up. I had to check the cows and fields to see everything was sound. At 9.00am I went into the house and had my breakfast. It was going to be a busy day because the vet was coming at 9.30 to inject the cows to see if they have any diseases.He took blood samples from all of the cows. At 12.30 that job was finished. At 1.30pm we put all the cows back into the fields where they had come from the night before. At 2.00pm the vet came back to burn the horns off the small calves with a hot iron. The vet gave them two jags to stop any pain.At 4.00pm we started to clean up, and at 5.00pm I went in for my tea.But that wasn't my day finished.I had to go and check the cow that was going to calf and before I went to my bed I went out once again. A long day!
